name: Don't Stop the Music! Trivia Game | Something in Common | 10 Questions

questions.text: A song simply titled "Don't" was released as a single on this country singer's "Greatest Hits" album.  Who sang the song?
questions.explanation:
Shania Twain.

	"Don't!" was released in 2004 on Shania Twain's "Greatest Hits" album.  It was released as a single in 2005 in many countries including the United States, Canada, and the United Kingdom.  The music video for "Don't!" was shot in Oaxaca, Mexico. Shania Twain also sings "Don't Be Stupid", which would have also worked.

questions.text: Journey first made this hit famous in the 1980s, and the song made a comeback when the "Glee" cast sang the song in the late 2000s.  What wildly popular hit is this?
questions.explanation:
Don't Stop Believin'.

	"Don't Stop Believin'" was released on Journey's 1981 album "Escape".  The song gained a lot of popularity then, and even more popularity when several television shows (including "Glee") used it in the mid- to late 2000s.  During the 21st century, its popularity became so high that the song was considered the best-selling digitally downloaded song that was released in the 20th century.  That's quite an honor! I could have used "Don't Be Down on Me Baby", but I like "Don't Stop Believin'" so much more.

questions.text: Tim McGraw sang a song about a little boy who didn't like girls too much, but throughout the song, we go through his life.  He ends up marrying the same girl he rejected when he was eight.  What is this sad song?
questions.explanation:
Don't Take the Girl.

	"Don't Take the Girl" was Tim McGraw's first single that hit number one, and was his fifth single overall.  It was released in 1994 on his album "Not a Moment Too Soon".  It reached number one on the Hot Country Songs chart, and even became quite successful on the pop charts. "Don't Mention Memphis" was another Tim McGraw option, but it's not nearly as well-known.

questions.text: Simple Minds sang a song called "Don't You (Forget About Me)".  It was wildly popular, especially since it was released on the soundtrack to a very popular movie.  What movie would that be?
questions.explanation:
The Breakfast Club.

	Simple Minds released "Don't You (Forget About Me)" in 1985.  It can be found on the "Breakfast Club Soundtrack" album.  It has also been used as an "American Idol" farewell song for season 10.

questions.text: "Don't Worry 'Bout a Thing" was the third single on the "Sweet Right Here" album (as an added hint: "Sweet Right Here" comes from some lyrics from "Passenger Seat").  Who sang the song?
questions.explanation:
SHeDAISY.

	SHeDAISY released "Don't Worry 'Bout a Thing" early in 2005 as a single.  It came from their 2004 album "Sweet Right Here".  Three singles came from that album, including "Don't Worry 'Bout a Thing", "Passenger Seat", and "Come Home Soon".

questions.text: "Don't Worry, Be Happy" was the first a capella song to reach number one on the charts.  Who sang the song?
questions.explanation:
Bobby McFerrin.

	Bobby McFerrin released "Don't Worry, Be Happy" in 1988.  It came from his album "Simple Pleasures".  It was number one on the Billboard Hot 100 for two weeks, and it was the first a capella song to ever achieve such a feat.

questions.text: An "American Idol" contestant sang "Don't Forget To Remember Me".  She became one of the biggest selling "American Idol" contestants ever when she released her first album.  Who was she?
questions.explanation:
Carrie Underwood.

	Carrie Underwood won her season of "American Idol", and even became a higher-selling artist than any previous "American Idol" contestant.  She released her first album "Some Hearts" in 2006.  "Don't Forget to Remember Me" was her fourth single from the album.

questions.text: What country band sings "Don't Let's Talk About Lisa"?  As an added hint, since this isn't too well known of a song, the band also sings "Amazed".
questions.explanation:
Lonestar.

	Lonestar released "Don't Let's Talk About Lisa" in 1999.  It was found on their album "Lonely Grill".  "Tell Her", "What About Now", "Everything's Changed", and "Smile" were also hits on their "Lonely Grill" album.

questions.text: Toby Keith sings a song called "Don't Leave", but what is the full title of the song?
questions.correct: Don't Leave (I Think I Love You)
questions.explanation:
Don't Leave (I Think I Love You).

	"Don't Leave (I Think I Love You)" was released on Toby Keith's album Shock'n Y'all".  It was released in 2003, and the album included major hits for Toby Keith including "I Love This Bar", "Whiskey Girl", and "American Soldier".

questions.text: "Don't Make Me" was a hit single on this artist's "Pure BS" album.  The BS is the artist's initials.  Who is the artist?
questions.explanation:
Blake Shelton.

	Blake Shelton released "Don't Make Me" as a single in 2006.  A few months later, in 2007, his album "Pure BS" was released.  The album contained the song, which reached number 12 on the US Billboard Country Songs, and only 79 on the Billboard Hot 100.
